revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=January 2014}} {{Use British English|date=January 2014}} '''Barunka O'Shaughnessy''' is a British actress, writer and producer.
Barunka began performing comedy while a student at [[Cambridge University]].<ref>[http://culture.bitchbuzz.com/bitchbuzzs-interview-with-barunka-oshaughnessy.html Bitchbuzz] BitchBuzz's Interview with Barunka O'Shaughnessy from Beehive. 15 Dec 2008, retrieved 24 February 2011</ref> After her graduation, she collaborated with university friends [[Lucy Montgomery (actress)|Lucy Montgomery]] and [[James Bachman]] to write and perform shows at the [[Edinburgh Festival]], forming the Population 3 Theatre company.
She is best known for playing [[Sacha Merrion]] on ''[[Bo! in the USA]]'' and for her appearances in [[The Mighty Boosh]].<ref name="IMDB">[https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1068055/ IMDB] Entry for Barunka O'Shaughnessy, retrieved 24 February 2011</ref> She has appeared in ''Mr and Mrs Fandango'' for Channel 4 as part of the ''[[Comedy Lab]]'' series and has also appeared in [[E4 (TV channel)|E4]]'s comedy sketch show [[Beehive (TV show)|''Beehive'']]. Other notable television credits include ''[[That Mitchell and Webb Look]]'', ''[[Bremner, Bird and Fortune]]'' and ''[[Extras (TV series)|Extras]]''.<ref name="IMDB"/> She has also appeared in the yearly [[Christmas]] TV adverts for [[Boots UK|Boots]].
On radio, she has starred in ''Sasha's Best of British'', a comedy pilot for [[BBC Radio 2]] which was broadcast on 12 May 2007. She plays Ping in the [[BBC Radio 4]] sitcom ''[[Ed Reardon's Week]]'' (Series 2 and 5-12 (2008-2017)).
As a writer, she has worked on ''[[Katy Brand's Big Ass Show]]'', ''[[Comedy Lab]]'', ''Beehive'', ''[[School of Comedy]]'' and ''[[Hunderby]]''. In 2001 she produced two seasons of the British television series ''[[Fanorama]]'', starring [[David Mitchell (comedian)|David Mitchell]], [[Rhys Thomas (comedian)|Rhys Thomas]], [[Claudia Winkleman]] and [[Lauren Laverne]].<ref name="IMDB"/>
As herself, she has guested on ''[[The Law of the Playground]]'', ''The Story of Light Entertainment'', and ''[[Never Mind the Buzzcocks]]''.<ref name="IMDB"/>
She is of Irish and Czech parentage.<ref>[https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/comedy/features/the-comedian-barunka-oshaughnessy-1208941.html The Independent] The comedian: Barunka O'Shaughnessy. 27 December 2008, retrieved 24 February 2011</ref>
